issue.title: clickndownload.org

labels.name: A: Cannot reproduce
labels.description: Filters devs cannot reproduce this issue

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Annoyance) [https://clickndownload.org/41ppc9h31pjf](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fclickndownload.org%2F41ppc9h31pjf) ### Comment > There's a hidden element which checks for clicks anywhere on the page that triggers nasty pop ups. Some are blocked by AdGuard when they open in a new tab, some are not and open malicious pages... But they still open either way. It's not in the screenshot, but a "chat" also appears in the bottom right. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/1x2fclvwh1s0w8o4wc0wo4w80g88wkg52s4jldeu2g.png?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard for Safari v1.11.15 Filters: | Ad Blocking:
AdGuard Base

Privacy:
AdGuard Tracking Protection,
Peter Lowe's Blocklist

Annoyances:
AdGuard Annoyances,
AdGuard Popups

Security:
Online Malicious URL Blocklist,
NoCoin Filter List

comment.body: Not reproduced, but added adserver and regexp rule to block future other adservers.

issue.title: www.youtube.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Social Widget) [https://www.youtube.com/@tunetankmusic/about](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2F%40tunetankmusic%2Fabout) ### Comment > I used AdGuard on Chromium, Brave, and Firefox. While AdGuard is active I can not unsubscribe from any video on YouTube on any browser. Disabling and trying the page again fails. If I disable AdGuard, close the browsers, then restart, the unsubscribe button is visible again. I did update filters. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/cq7zhgkoi08o4skkkgwcg8ggock0socbliaty4vxnk.jpg?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard Browser extension v4.2.168 Browser: | Chrome Stealth mode options: | Hide your search queries,
Send Do-Not-Track header,
Remove X-Client-Data header from HTTP requests,
Self-destructing third-party cookies (2880),
Hide your Referrer from third-parties Filters: | Ad Blocking:
AdGuard Base

Privacy:
AdGuard Tracking Protection

Social Widgets:
AdGuard Social Media

Security:
Online Malicious URL Blocklist,
NoCoin Filter List Other extensions used: | cookie auto delete

issue.title: www.engadget.com

labels.name: A: Cannot reproduce
labels.description: Filters devs cannot reproduce this issue

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

labels.name: A: Waiting for data
labels.description: Waiting for more information from the user

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Annoyance) [http://www.engadget.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.engadget.com) ### Comment > This site is showing a blocking modal when using Global Privacy Control that still appears with the AdGuard Annoyances and AdGuard Cookie Notices filter lists enabled. > > To reproduce, set `privacy.globalprivacycontrol.enabled` to `true` in the latest Firefox 116.0 (119.0), then confirm its enabled on https://globalprivacycontrol.org. > > Suggested filter rule: www.engadget.com###consent-gpc-popUp ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/d9ps77ockyokkk40400kgwww8sgckgcqmptj6m04kg.png?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- Platform: | AdGuard filter lists (Ads, tracking protection, annoyances and cookie notices) System version: | macOS 14.1 Browser: | Firefox Filters: | Ad Blocking:
AdGuard Base

Privacy:
AdGuard Tracking Protection,
AdGuard URL Tracking

Annoyances:

AdGuard Cookie Notices,
AdGuard Popups,
AdGuard Mobile App Banners,
AdGuard Other Annoyances,
AdGuard Widgets Other extensions used: | uBlock Origin

comment.body:
The HAR file was sent on Nov. 8 to `filters@adguard.com`.

> Ok? Scrolling is not blocked?
> `yahoo.com,techcrunch.com###consent-gpc-popUp`

This rule works as well. No issues with scrolling.
